newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian coconut oil stable, copra down.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian coconut oil stable, copra down.

text.p: Indonesian coconut prices were stable on Friday on thin buying interest, while copra fell further because of ample supply, traders said.
"The overall market sentiment remains poor because of sluggish demand. Many traders also believe that buyers will turn to olein because it's much cheaper," said one trader.
Traders said coconut oil was quoted at 1,750 rupiah/kg in Jakarta, unchanged since last week, but copra fell to 730 rupiah/kg against 800 rupiah/kg last week.
Traders said copra supply was abundant in the Indonesian market and this had pushed the price down.
Traders said palm olein, which is a coconut oil substitute, was quoted at 1,450-55 rupiah/kg in Jakarta, unchanged from Thursday's close.
Manila traders said on Monday coconut oil prices were expected to remain steady or weaken this week as improving production prompted traders to sell short their stocks.
Data released on Monday also showed coconut oil stocks in Rotterdam fell to 21,426 tonnes against 22,305 tonnes last week.
